page.title: 09VICTORIAN ATHERSTONE
page.content: The improvement in communications due to the development of the canal and railway was linked to a growth in population and the development of industry in Atherstone.By 1891 the pop. was 4991.In 1851 there were 4 hat manufacturers,the two main ones being Joseph Willday and James Vero.The town itself was limited to large private houses,shops and Â£yards' where most of the pop. lived-accommodation was over- crowded(10 to a house),the workhouse provided alternative shelter(sited at the present day Regal Cinema).Although conditions were hard, life had its compensations-Atherstone has always had more than its fair share of pubs and many of the yards had their own ale house facing the street eg Hand and Bottle, Swan and Neck and the Angel. The sign "The Angel Yard" can still be seen by The Angel pub in Church Street.
